properties.entry:
TTY backend syntax: "stdio" ";" <port> | "file" ";" <port> ";" <path> | "nmdm" ";" <port>
Where: <port> = "com1" | "com2" | "bootrom"
Examples: stdio;com1 file;bootrom;/tmp/xyz nmdm;com2

Storage backend syntax: "file" ";" <path> | "zfs-volume"
Where: <path> = Any UNIX-like path
Examples: file;/tmp/xyz zfs-volume

Virtio network backend syntax: "tap" ";" <tapDevice> ";" <macAddress> | "vmnet" ";" <vmnetDevice> ";" <macAddress>
Where: <tapDevice> = "tap[0-9]'{'1,13'}'" <vmnetDevice> = "vmnet[0-9]'{'1,11'}'" <macAddress> = "[a-f0-9]'{'2'}':[a-f0-9]'{'2'}':[a-f0-9]'{'2'}':[a-f0-9]'{'2'}':[a-f0-9]'{'2'}':[a-f0-9]'{'2'}'"
Examples: tap;tap23;d9:63:c0:d9:09:e8 tap;tap0000000000001;d9:63:c0:d9:09:e8 vmnet;vmnet23;d9:63:c0:d9:09:e8 vmnet;vmnet00000000001;d9:63:c0:d9:09:e8
No boot configuration exists with the given name: {0}
A boot configuration already exists with the given name: {0}
Backend device names must be unique: {0}
Added virtio disk zfs volume {0} @ slot {1}

The "vm-run" command starts a virtual machine. The command, internally, uses execve()[0] to replace the waxmill process with that of the Bhyve virtual machine. The virtual machine stays running in the foreground. The command is intended to be used to start virtual machines under process supervision systems such as daemontools[1] or runit[2].
[0] https://www.freebsd.org/cgi/man.cgi?query=execve&sektion=2 [1] https://cr.yp.to/daemontools.html [2] http://smarden.org/runit/

The "schema" command lists the available XSD[0] schemas available for the various XML formats used by the waxmill tools. The command can dump the text of specific schemas when passed the identifier of a schema.
[0] https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema11-1/
